body.raw:
This year, I finally turn 20.

When I think about that number, or my "birthday", I feel an overwhelming amount of disgust.

Think of it. In 2020, when I was 15, I was making ~$200 a month. I would've expected myself to be in the investment business, following my passions and worth at least a few hundred thousand.

I haven't grown.

In some sense, I'm mad at myself, but in another, more weaker sense, I'm mad at society.

There was no one to guide me. There wasn't anyone really pushing me to focus on studies and even befriend people. I'm a shell of a proper human.

I generally didn't really care about my lack of progress over the last few years, but this year, it's really hitting me. 20 years old. I'm 2 years older than 18.

I mean, what am I doing here? in 10 years, I'll be thirty years old! What will I do throughout these years? The times of being a child and not caring about life are over.

I have to look forward, focus on building something tangible that I can say I "worked on", in 10 years time.
